results.title: Yu Opera performers [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Directed, photographed and edited by Liu Shumin, this documentary film presents an intimate view into the lives of husband and wife team, Zhao Feng and Lu Ronghua, Xi’an’s famous Yu Opera performers. Yu Opera emerged during the late Ming Dynasty and is designed more for the broad masses with its stories of social themes and the working class. It is mostly dominated by singing opera arias with minimal make-up, costuming and acting and performed at traditional Tea-houses. The documentary includes behind-the-scenes and backstage operations and negotiations as the local Henan TV Station prepare a live-to-air performance of their Art Troupe featuring Lu Ronghua and Zhao Feng. It also follows Lu and Zhao’s bid to establish their own Teahouse - their financial problems, legal negotiations and the long and frustrating bureaucratical system that keeps on hindering them from achieving their ambition of bringing traditional Chinese culture to the masses. Shumin’s photography is quite evocative, particularly his images of the Chinese landscape, and although the film is at times slow-moving, it still provides a most interesting insight into Chinese customs, daily life and Yu Opera. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Youth workers tapes
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Australia Open Chanel
results.brief_description: A series of six segments designed to estimulate discussion on various issues related to youth work. Four of the episodes contain dramatized situations depicting the difficulties faced by young people. Two of the episodes concentrate on the views of the youth workers in the field and youths who have been wards of he state.

results.title: Youth suicide: Don't solve the problem alone
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Youth Affairs and Victoria. Dept. of Human Services
results.brief_description: Terry Laidler presents the first in a series of interactive seminars addressing adolescent mental health linking a Statewide panel via satellite to 25 rural centres. The panel comprises Hon. Denis Napthine, Minister, Youth & Community Services who outlines Victorian Government preventative regional initiatives, Dr. Micheal Schwarz, Psychiatrist, Centre for Adolescent Health, Parkville, Constance Jenkins, Family therapist and manager Parenting Adolescence Australia, Thersea Lynch, social worker, Sutherland Community Resource Centre who co-ordinates a violence prevention program in secondary schools and Liz Wightwick from the Mildura Suicide Prevention Working Party. The panel then fields questions from a studio audience and by telephone.

results.title: Youth of the world = Die Jungend der welt
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Fox, Bavaria Film and UFA
results.brief_description: Documentary about the 1936 Winter Olympics in Germany - edited by Carl Junghans in a style which pre-figures Leni Riefenstahl’s approach to her film of the main Olympics.

results.title: Youth of the Nation
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Tara from Redan told this story because “…its my greatest expertise. I’m young, I’m surrounded by young people everyday and advocate on behalf of them so it makes sense”.

results.title: Youth of Japan
results.brief_description: Like young people everywhere, the youth of modern Japan display vision, hope and enthusiasm for life and strength of purpose. This is illustrated by impressions of the lives of a typical young factory worker, shop assistant and student.

results.title: Youth in freedom
results.brief_description: Deals with the various youth activities in Germany. Funds are provided annually by the government for youth organisations. We see young people at sporting grounds, on camping trips and in youth hostels.
